intro: Mariscus sieberianus var. subcompositus, commonly known as the Sierra mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils in mountainous regions. Its foliage is aromatic, and it has a short growing season, blooming in late spring to early summer. The species is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for local wildlife.
